comedian volodymyr zelenskiy, who play ukraine 's president on tv, be lead election the strong showing reflect the public longing for a fresh leader who have no link to the corruption-ridden ukrainian political elite. kiev, ukraine ( ap ) — early result in ukraine ’ s presidential election show a comedian with no political experience maintain his strong lead against the incumbent president in the first round, set the stage for a runoff in three week. with nearly 70 percent of the polling station count monday, volodymyr zelenskiy have 30 percent of sunday ’ s vote, while incumbent president petro poroshenko be a distant second with just over 16 percent. ex-prime minister yulia tymoshenko trail behind with 13 percent. the result be in sync with a top exit poll. the strong showing for the 41-year-old zelenskiy reflect the public longing for a fresh leader who have no link to the corruption-ridden ukrainian political elite and can offer a new approach to settle the grind five-year conflict with russia-backed separatist in eastern ukraine. “ this be only the first step toward a great victory, ” zelenskiy say after see the exit poll finding. the top two candidate advance to a runoff on april 21. final result in sunday ’ s first round be expect to be announce later monday. zelenskiy dismiss suggestion that he could pool force with tymoshenko to get the backing of her voter in the second round in exchange for form a coalition follow parliamentary election in the fall. “ we aren ’ t make any deal with anyone, ” he say. “ we be young people. we don ’ t want to see all the past in our future, the future of our country. ” like the character he play in a tv sitcom, a schoolteacher turn president, zelenskiy make fight corruption a focus of his candidacy. he propose a lifetime ban on hold public office for anyone convict of graft. he also call for direct negotiation with russia on end the conflict in eastern ukraine. the election be mar by allegation of widespread vote buying. police say they have receive more than 2,100 complaint of violation on vote day alone in addition to hundred of early voting fraud claim, include bribery attempt and remove ballot from poll place. zelenskiy ’ s headquarters allege multiple voting and other cheat on the part of poroshenko ’ s campaign, but election official say the vote take place without significant violation. “ it be important for u to tell you that no systematic violation take place on either the election day or the night follow the election when vote be be count at the local polling station, ” say central election commission head tetyana slipachuk. poroshenko look somber a the vote come in, but visibly relieve about surpass tymoshenko to advance to the runoff. “ i critically and soberly understand the signal that society give today to the act authority, ” he say. “ it ’ s a tough lesson for me and my team. it ’ s a reason for serious work to correct mistake make over the past years. ” it be not clear whether he would or could adjust his campaign enough to meet zelenskiy ’ s challenge over the next three week. poroshenko, 53, a confectionery tycoon before he be elect five year ago, saw approval of his govern sink amid ukraine ’ s economic woe and a sharp plunge in living standard. poroshenko campaign on promise to defeat the rebel in the east and to wrest back control of crimea, which russia annex in 2014 in a move that have draw sanction against russia from the u.s. and the european union. a military embezzlement scheme that allegedly involve top poroshenko associate, as well a a factory control by the president, dog poroshenko before this election. ultra-right activist shadow him throughout the campaign, demand the jailing of the president ’ s associate accuse in the scandal. poroshenko after the vote hit back at zelenskiy, describe him a a pawn of self-exiled billionaire businessman igor kolomoyskyi, charge that zelenskiy denies. “ fate pit me against kolomoyskyi ’ s puppet in the runoff, ” he say. “ we win ’ t leave a single chance for kolomoyskyi. ” zelenskiy quickly shoot back, say mockingly that it ’ s impossible to say whether a corrupt official involve in the military embezzlement scheme be poroshenko ’ s puppet, or the other way round. with the lineup for the runoff become clear, voter be pick side. “ poroshenko be take the country forward, ” say serhiy poltorachenko, a bank employee. “ he make mistake, but promise to correct them. poroshenko will win because ukrainians win ’ t like to have a clown at the country ’ s helm. ” petro demidchenko, a 38-year-old office worker, say he be support zelenskiy even though he be an unknown quantity. “ we don ’ t know what to expect from zelenskiy, but over the past five year we have find out what to expect from poroshenko — corruption, soar price, continue war and poverty, ” he say.

santa anita park horse death toll rise to 23 the famed racetrack outside los angeles have come under scrutiny in recent week follow an unusually high number of equine death. another racehorse have die at santa anita park, the famed thoroughbred racetrack outside los angeles, follow a two-horse spill on sunday. the fatality bring the equine death toll at the track to 23 since dec. 26 — an unusually high number at a facility once consider among the safe in the sport. arm runner, a 5-year-old horse own by rockingham ranch, suffer a severe and ultimately fatal injury to his right front leg when he fell during the grade 3 $ 100,000 san simeon stake, nbc los angeles report. the incident cause a trailing horse to also tumble, but that animal quickly rise to it foot without apparent injury. santa anita park have just reopen on friday after the death of 22 horse at the racetrack prompt a weekslong suspension. prior to the resumption of race, the stronach group, which own santa anita, have announce that it be take the unprecedented step of ban race-day medication as well a introduce several new regulation, like demand complete transparency of all veterinary record, in an effort to protect racehorse from harm. “ the sport of horse racing be the last great sport legacy platform to be modernize. if we expect our sport to grow for future generation, we must raise our standard, ” belinda stronach, president of the stronach group, say in a statement. she add that the new initiative represent a “ seismic shift ” in how the sport be conduct. “ first and foremost, we must do right by the horse. when we do right by the horse, everything ― everything ― will follow, ” stronach say. racegoers breathe a “ sigh of relief ” on friday after the first race day back end with zero death, the los angeles time report. “ the public be probably a little shell-shocked at what ’ s go on. we ’ ve get a lot of bad exposure from everywhere. we ’ re go to need to go a long time without have something horrible happen, ” a horse owner tell the time a she watch the race. arm runner die two day later. most of the equine death at santa anita since december ― include arm runner ’ s ― have occur on the dirt surface of the track, the associated press report. however, when official inspect and renovate the dirt surface last month, they say they find no issue with it. santa anita ’ s equine death toll be significantly higher this year than in year prior. from december 2017 to february 2018, 10 horse die at the racetrack, per nbc los angeles. over the same period in 2016-2017, the toll be eight.

explain : today 's brexit 'indicative vote ' and what happen next here we go again. against the backdrop of a conservative party leadership race and talk of a loom general election, member of parliament ( mp ) will on monday hold a second round of so-called “ indicative ” vote on alternative to prime minister theresa may ’ s brexit deal. it be widely expect the option most likely to get a house of common majority be for a custom union — a much soft brexit than the one offer by the prime minister. tory chief whip julian smith have say that the parliamentary arithmetic mean a “ soft type of brexit ” be inevitable. the result of the vote be not bind on the government. but the pm will come under intense political pressure to adopt whatever parliament decides. david gauke, the justice secretary, warn on sunday that it would not be “ sustainable ” for may to ignore the will of parliament. the mp behind the plan have warn if may ignore the vote, parliament will move to change the law to give her no choice. john bercow, the speaker of the common, will choose from the list below which will be put to a vote at 8 p.m. bst ( 3 p.m. et ). motion a : unilateral right of exit from the backstop. tory lawmaker, lead by john baron, want the uk to leave the european union on may 22, 2019, with the withdrawal agreement amend to allow the uk unilaterally to exit the controversial northern ireland backstop. motion b : no deal in the absence of a withdrawal agreement. another proposal from baron, which call for a no-deal brexit on april 12 if no withdrawal agreement can be agree by the common. motion c : custom union. tory former chancellor ken clarke ’ s custom union plan require any brexit deal to include, a a minimum, a commitment to negotiate a “ permanent and comprehensive uk-wide custom union with the eu ”. this be defeat by the small margin in the first round, fall just six vote short. motion d : common market 2.0. put forth by conservative nick bole, robert halfon and dame caroline spelman and labour ’ s stephen kinnock, lucy powell plus the scottish national party ’ s ( snp ) stewart hosie. the motion propose uk membership of the european free trade association and european economic area. it allow continued participation in the single market and a “ comprehensive custom arrangement ” with the eu after brexit – include a “ uk say ” on future eu trade deal – would remain in place until the agreement of a wider trade deal which guarantee frictionless movement of good and an open border in ireland. motion e : confirmatory public vote. it have be draw up by labour mp peter kyle and phil wilson. this motion would require a public vote to confirm any brexit deal pass by parliament before it ratification. this option, put forward last time by labour former minister dame margaret beckett, poll the high number of vote although be defeat by 295 vote to 268. motion f : public vote to prevent no deal. move by labour ’ s graham jones and tory former minister dominic grieve, this proposal would require a referendum, if necessary, to prevent the uk leave the eu without a deal. motion g : parliamentary supremacy. snp mp joanna cherry join with grieve and mp from other party with this plan to seek an extension to the brexit process, and if this be not possible then parliament will choose between either no-deal or revoke article 50. an inquiry would follow to assess the future relationship likely to be acceptable to brussels and have majority support in the uk. motion h : efta and eea. a motion put forward by conservative mp george eustice – who quit a agriculture minister to fight for brexit – propose rejoin the european free trade association ( efta ) at the “ early opportunity ”, agree a short extension to the uk ’ s membership of the eu to conclude accession to efta and negotiate with the eu additional protocol relate to the northern ireland border and agri-food trade. if at first, second and third you don ’ t succeed — give it another bash. on friday, mps reject the prime minister ’ s late attempt to push a version of her deal through. but it look like she be gear up for another swing later this week. in theory, a common majority for a soft brexit in the indicative vote could actually help the pm. down street will hope it will scare the remain hardcore pro-brexit tory mp who oppose the pm into finally back her deal a the least bad option. to add to the pressure on tory mp, may have hint she might be prepare to go for the nuclear option of try to hold a general election to try and break the impasse. even though that do not go very well for her last time. “ i fear we be reach the limit of this process in this house, ” the pm tell the common last week. deputy party chairman jam cleverly upped the ante on sunday when he declare “ sensible and pragmatic ” preparation be under way in case the government be force to go to the country early. alistair burt, the former foreign office minister who resign from the government last week to back the indicative vote, sum up the mood of many backbencher. “ i be with brenda from bristol on this, ‘ oh no, not another one! ’
